required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: One-Year Trial of Oral Ziprasidone in Bipolar Patients With Metabolic Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: A One-year, Phase III, Open-label, Non-comparative Trial of the Effect of Ziprasidone HCl on Metabolic Syndrome Risk Factors in Patients With Bipolar Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to explore the impact of Ziprasidone HCl on the distribution of metabolic syndrome (MS) risk factors in a population of Bipolar patients presenting with glucose intolerance, dyslipidemia and/or elevated waist circumference associated with their current antipsychotic medication.

detailed_description.textblock: The trial was terminated prematurely on December 14, 2010, due to inability to recruit the planned number of subjects and shifting organizational priorities. The decision to terminate the trial was not based on any safety or efficacy concerns.

clinical_study.why_stopped: See termination reason in detailed description.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved a Reduction From Baseline of at Least 1 Risk Factor for Metabolic Syndrome (MS) at Week 52 or Premature Discontinuation
primary_outcome.description: MS risks factors: elevated (el) waist circumference: ≥102 centimeters (cm) in men and ≥88 cm in women (Asian origin: ≥90 cm [men] and ≥80 cm [women]); el triglycerides: ≥1.7 millimoles per liter (mmol/L) (1≥50 milligrams per deciliter [mg/dL]); reduced high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C): <1.03 mmol/L (<40 mg/dL) in men and <1.3 mmol/L (<50 mg/dL) in women; el fasting glucose: ≥5.6 mmol/L (≥100 mg/dL); and el systolic/diastolic blood pressure: systolic ≥130 millimeters of mercury (mmHg) and/or diastolic ≥85 mmHg. Responder = at least 1 less risk factor at endpoint than baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in the Number of Risk Factors of Metabolic Syndrome (MS)
secondary_outcome.description: MS risks factors: elevated waist circumference: ≥102 cm in men and ≥88 cm in women (Asian origin: ≥90 cm [men] and ≥80 cm [women]); elevated triglycerides: ≥1.7 mmol/L (1≥50 mg/dL); reduced HDL-C: <1.03 mmol/L (<40 mg/dL) in men and <1.3 mmol/L (<50 mg/dL) in women; elevated fasting glucose: ≥5.6 mmol/L (≥100 mg/dL); and elevated systolic/diastolic blood pressure: systolic blood pressure ≥130 mm Hg and/or diastolic blood pressure ≥85 mm Hg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Metabolic Syndrome (MS) Prevalence
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants at each visit defined as having metabolic syndrome (MS) based on the National Cholesterol Education Program (NCEP) Adult Treatment Panel III. MS = 3 or more of 5 characteristics: abdominal obesity, hypertriglyceridemia, low high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol, high blood pressure, and high fasting glucose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Percentage of Participants With Each Individual Metabolic Syndrome (MS) Risk Factor
secondary_outcome.description: MS risks factors: elevated waist circumference: ≥102 cm in men and ≥88 cm in women (Asian origin: ≥90 cm [men] and ≥80 cm [women]); elevated triglycerides: ≥1.7 mmol/L (1≥50 mg/dL); reduced HDL-C: <1.03 mmol/L (<40 mg/dL) in men and <1.3 mmol/L (<50 mg/dL) in women; elevated fasting glucose: ≥5.6 mmol/L (≥100 mg/dL); and elevated systolic/diastolic blood pressure: systolic blood pressure ≥130 mm Hg and/or diastolic blood pressure ≥85 mm Hg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Individual Metabolic Syndrome (MS) Risk Factors
secondary_outcome.description: MS risks factors = elevated waist circumference: ≥102 cm in men and ≥88 cm in women (Asian origin: ≥90 cm [men] and ≥80 cm [women]); elevated triglycerides: ≥1.7 mmol/L (1≥50 mg/dL); reduced HDL-C: <1.03 mmol/L (<40 mg/dL) in men and <1.3 mmol/L (<50 mg/dL) in women; elevated fasting glucose: ≥5.6 mmol/L (≥100 mg/dL); and elevated systolic/diastolic blood pressure: systolic blood pressure ≥130 mm Hg and/or diastolic blood pressure ≥85 mm Hg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Individual Risk Factors of Metabolic Syndrome (MS): Elevated Waist Circumference
secondary_outcome.description: MS risk factor elevated waist circumference defined as ≥102 centimeters (cm) in men and ≥88 cm in women (Asian origin: ≥90 cm [men] and ≥80 cm [women]).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Individual Risk Factors of Metabolic Syndrome (MS): Elevated Systolic/Diastolic Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.description: MS risk factor elevated systolic/diastolic blood pressure defined as systolic blood pressure ≥130 millimeters of mercury (mm Hg) and/or diastolic blood pressure ≥85 mm Hg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Individual Risk Factors of Metabolic Syndrome (MS): Elevated Fasting Glucose
secondary_outcome.description: MS risk factor elevated fasting glucose defined as ≥5.6 millimoles per liter (mmol/L) (≥100 mg/dL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Individual Risk Factors of Metabolic Syndrome (MS): Reduced High-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C)
secondary_outcome.description: MS risk factor reduced HDL-C defined as <1.03 millimoles per liter (mmol/L) (<40 mg/dL) in men and <1.3 mmol/L (<50 mg/dL) in women.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Individual Risk Factors of Metabolic Syndrome (MS): Elevated Triglycerides
secondary_outcome.description: MS risk factor elevated triglycerides defined as ≥1.7 millimoles per liter (mmol/L) (1≥50 mg/dL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Ten-year Coronary Heart Disease (CHD) Risk According to Framingham Scoring System
secondary_outcome.description: Framingham scoring system risk factors: age (risk points range: -9 to 16), cholesterol (risk points range: 0 to 13), HDL cholesterol (risk points range: -1 to 2), smoking (risk points range: 0 to 9), and systolic blood pressure (risk points range: 0 to 6); total risk points range <0 to ≥25, higher score indicates higher 10 year risk (range <1% to ≥30% 10 year risk).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Total Cholesterol and Low-density Lipoprotein (LDL) Cholesterol Levels
Change From Baseline in Weight
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 12, Week 52 or Early Termination

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Body Mass Index (BMI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 12, Week 52 or Early Termination
secondary_outcome.description: Body mass index = weight in kilograms (kg) / height in meters (m)^2 .

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin (HbA1c)
Change From Baseline in Insulin Levels
Change From Baseline in Corrected QT Interval (QTc): Fridericia's Heart Rate Correction Formula (QTcF)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 52 or Early Termination
secondary_outcome.description: QT interval is the time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac electrical cycle. QTc is the QT interval corrected for heart rate. Corrected QT interval using Fridericia's heart rate correction formula: QTcF = QT/RR^1/3, where RR=RR interval in seconds.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Apolipoprotein B (ApoB) Levels
Change From Baseline in Leptin
Change From Baseline in Physical Activity Index
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 28, Week 52 or Early Termination
secondary_outcome.description: Physical activity (exercise) score derived for each participant based on the frequency and intensity of physical activities: regular walking, recreational activity, cycling, and sporting activity. Six categories of total score: inactive (range: 0-2), occasional (range: 3-5), light (range: 6-8), moderate (range: 9-12), moderately vigorous (range: 13-20), and vigorous (≥21). Higher score = higher frequency and intensity of physical activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) - Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 12, Week 28, Week 52 or Early Termination
secondary_outcome.description: Measures the overall severity of depressive symptoms. The MADRS has a 10-item checklist. Items are rated on a scale of 0-6, for a total score range of 0 (low severity of depressive symptoms) to 60 (high severity of depressive symptoms).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 12, Week 28, Week 52 or Early Termination
secondary_outcome.description: 11-item scale that measures the severity of manic episodes from subject reported symptoms over previous 48 hours and clinical observation during interview. Four items (irritability, speech, thought content, disruptive-aggressive behaviour) are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 8 (symptom extremely severe). The remaining 7 items (elevated mood, increased motor activity-energy, sexual interest, sleep, language-thought disorder, appearance, insight) are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 4 (symptom extremely severe). YMRS total score range = 0 to 60.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Clinical Global Impression - Severity (CGI-S) Subscale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 12, Week 28, Week 52 or Early Termination
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-S: 7-point clinician rated scale to assess severity of participant's current illness state; range: 1 (normal - not ill at all) to 7 (among the most extremely ill patients). Higher score = more affected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impression - Improvement (CGI-I) Subscale Score
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-I: 7-point clinician rated scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved), 2 (much improved), or 3 (minimally improved) on the scale. Higher score = more affected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Drug Attitude Inventory (DAI)
secondary_outcome.description: DAI, a 10-item scale to assess how the attitude of schizophrenia participants toward their medications may affect compliance. Respondents indicate 'true' or 'false' for each item. An overall calculated score ranged from -10 to 10, where a positive score indicated a positive subjective response (compliant), a negative score indicated non-compliance. Change: score at observation minus score at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Social and Occupational Functioning Assessment Scale (SOFAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 28, Week 52 or Early Termination
secondary_outcome.description: 0-100 single score scale focusing exclusively on participant's level of social and occupational functioning; not directly influenced by overall severity of participant's psychological symptoms; higher score = higher level of functioning. 1 to 10 = persistent inability to maintain minimal personal hygiene; unable to function without harming self or others or without considerable external support; 91 to 100 = superior functioning in a wide range of activities.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in EuroQoL Index (EQ-I)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 28, Week 52 or Early Termination
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D: subject rated questionnaire to assess health-related quality of life in terms of a single utility score. Health State Profile component assesses level of current health for 5 domains: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain and discomfort, and anxiety and depression; 1 indicates better health state (no problems); 3 indicates worst health state (confined to bed). Scoring formula developed by EuroQol Group assigns a utility value for each domain in the profile. Score is transformed and results in a total score range -0.594 to 1.000; higher score indicates a better health state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in European Quality of Life (EuroQol) Visual Analogue Scale (EQ-5D VAS): Current Health State Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 28, Week 52 or Early Termination
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D: subject rated questionnaire to assess health-related quality of life in terms of a single index value. The VAS component rates current health state on a scale from 0 (worst imaginable health state) to 100 (best imaginable health state); higher scores indicate a better health state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Impact of Weight on Quality of Life-Lite Version (IWQOL-Lite) Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 28, Week 52 or Early Termination
secondary_outcome.description: 31-item self report inventory to assess impact of weight on quality of life. Five subscales: physical functioning, self-esteem, sexual life, public distress, and work, with categories in each subscale scored 1 (no trouble or difficulty) to 5 (persistent trouble or difficulty). The rescaled IWQoL-Lite score is determined by the sum of scores on all 31 items and rescaling this sum to a 1 to 100 scoring with 0=the poorest and 100=the best quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Suicidal Tendencies (Columbian-Suicide Severity Rating Scale, [C-SSRS], Mapped to C-CASA [Columbia Classification Algorithm For Suicide Assessment])
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1 through Week 52 or Early Termination
secondary_outcome.description: C-SSRS is a participant rated questionnaire to assess suicidal ideation, suicidal behavior, actual attempts (yes or no responses), and intensity of ideation (rated 1=low severity to 5=high severity). Yes/No responses are mapped to Columbia Classification Algorithm of Suicide Assessment (C-CASA) categories: Completed suicide, suicide attempt, preparatory acts toward imminent suicidal behavior, suicidal ideation, and self-injurious behavior, or no suicidal intent. A participant could have a yes or no response in more than one category.

intervention.description: Ziprasidone Hydrochloride 20 to 80 mg administered orally twice a day (40-160 mg total daily dose) for up to 1 year.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject must present at least 2 of the following risk factors of MS at screening: Elevated waist circumference: >102 cm in men and >88 cm in women; Elevated triglycerides (TGs): ≥1.7 mmol/L (≥150 mg/dL); Reduced HDL-Cholesterol: <1.03 mmol/L (<40 mg/dL) in men and <1.3 mmol/L (<50 mg/dL) in women; Elevated fasting glucose: ≥ 5.6 mmol/L.
- According to the clinical judgment of the investigator, the risk factors for MS have developed in close temporal relationship to starting an antipsychotic medication.
- Substitution to a less metabolically disruptive antipsychotic medication is considered
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with contraindication(s) to the use of Ziprasidone according to Canadian prescribing information.
- Subjects with a history of treatment resistance.
- Subjects with any medical condition (e.g. pre-existing diabetes, pre-existing dyslipidemia, thyroid pathology) or taking any concomitant medication (e.g. topiramate or other weight loss-promoting agents, hypoglycemic agents, hypolipemic agents), that may confound the evaluation of the study drug.
- Body mass index ≥ 40 at baseline.

facility.name: Foothills Medical Centre, Department of Psychiatry
Mental Health Centre for Research and Education
Edgeland Medical, Dr. Alla Kirshner Medical Corporation

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Twenty-seven participants were screened for the study and 13 participants were assigned to study drug and treated.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Days 1 to 3: 40 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID); Days 4 to 7: 60 mg BID; Days 8 to15: 80 mg BID; Day 16 to Week 52: 20-80 mg BID flexible dosing.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Days 1 to 3: 40 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID); Days 4 to 7: 60 mg BID; Days 8 to15: 80 mg BID; Day 16 to Week 52: 20-80 mg BID flexible dosing.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved a Reduction From Baseline of at Least 1 Risk Factor for Metabolic Syndrome (MS) at Week 52 or Premature Discontinuation
outcome.description: MS risks factors: elevated (el) waist circumference: ≥102 centimeters (cm) in men and ≥88 cm in women (Asian origin: ≥90 cm [men] and ≥80 cm [women]); el triglycerides: ≥1.7 millimoles per liter (mmol/L) (1≥50 milligrams per deciliter [mg/dL]); reduced high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C): <1.03 mmol/L (<40 mg/dL) in men and <1.3 mmol/L (<50 mg/dL) in women; el fasting glucose: ≥5.6 mmol/L (≥100 mg/dL); and el systolic/diastolic blood pressure: systolic ≥130 millimeters of mercury (mmHg) and/or diastolic ≥85 mmHg. Responder = at least 1 less risk factor at endpoint than baseline.
outcome.population: Per protocol population: all subjects in the intent-to-treat population who remained in the study for at least 28 weeks. N = number of participants with analyzable data at observation.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in the Number of Risk Factors of Metabolic Syndrome (MS)
outcome.description: MS risks factors: elevated waist circumference: ≥102 cm in men and ≥88 cm in women (Asian origin: ≥90 cm [men] and ≥80 cm [women]); elevated triglycerides: ≥1.7 mmol/L (1≥50 mg/dL); reduced HDL-C: <1.03 mmol/L (<40 mg/dL) in men and <1.3 mmol/L (<50 mg/dL) in women; elevated fasting glucose: ≥5.6 mmol/L (≥100 mg/dL); and elevated systolic/diastolic blood pressure: systolic blood pressure ≥130 mm Hg and/or diastolic blood pressure ≥85 mm Hg.
outcome.population: PP and Intent-to-treat (ITT) population; ITT population = all participants enrolled in the study who received at least 1 dose of study medication and who had baseline and at least 1 post-baseline MS measurement. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Ten-year Coronary Heart Disease (CHD) Risk According to Framingham Scoring System
measure.description: Framingham scoring system risk factors: age (risk points range: -9 to 16), cholesterol (risk points range: 0 to 13), HDL cholesterol (risk points range: -1 to 2), smoking (risk points range: 0 to 9), and systolic blood pressure (risk points range: 0 to 6); total risk points range <0 to ≥25, higher score indicates higher 10 year risk (range <1% to ≥30% 10 year risk).
measure.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

outcome.population: PP and ITT. Median was reported due to small sample size and risk of skewing.

measure.population: PP and ITT. Insulin levels not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Corrected QT Interval (QTc): Fridericia's Heart Rate Correction Formula (QTcF)
outcome.description: QT interval is the time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac electrical cycle. QTc is the QT interval corrected for heart rate. Corrected QT interval using Fridericia's heart rate correction formula: QTcF = QT/RR^1/3, where RR=RR interval in seconds.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 52 or Early Termination
outcome.population: PP and ITT; n = number of participants with analyzable data at observation.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Days 1 to 3: 40 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID); Days 4 to 7: 60 mg BID; Days 8 to15: 80 mg BID; Day 16 to Week 52: 20-80 mg BID flexible dosing.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Corrected QT Interval (QTc): Fridericia's Heart Rate Correction Formula (QTcF)
measure.description: QT interval is the time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac electrical cycle. QTc is the QT interval corrected for heart rate. Corrected QT interval using Fridericia's heart rate correction formula: QTcF = QT/RR^1/3, where RR=RR interval in seconds.
measure.population: PP and ITT; n = number of participants with analyzable data at observation.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Physical Activity Index
outcome.description: Physical activity (exercise) score derived for each participant based on the frequency and intensity of physical activities: regular walking, recreational activity, cycling, and sporting activity. Six categories of total score: inactive (range: 0-2), occasional (range: 3-5), light (range: 6-8), moderate (range: 9-12), moderately vigorous (range: 13-20), and vigorous (≥21). Higher score = higher frequency and intensity of physical activity.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 28, Week 52 or Early Termination
outcome.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Days 1 to 3: 40 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID); Days 4 to 7: 60 mg BID; Days 8 to15: 80 mg BID; Day 16 to Week 52: 20-80 mg BID flexible dosing.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Physical Activity Index
measure.description: Physical activity (exercise) score derived for each participant based on the frequency and intensity of physical activities: regular walking, recreational activity, cycling, and sporting activity. Six categories of total score: inactive (range: 0-2), occasional (range: 3-5), light (range: 6-8), moderate (range: 9-12), moderately vigorous (range: 13-20), and vigorous (≥21). Higher score = higher frequency and intensity of physical activity.
measure.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) - Total Score
outcome.description: Measures the overall severity of depressive symptoms. The MADRS has a 10-item checklist. Items are rated on a scale of 0-6, for a total score range of 0 (low severity of depressive symptoms) to 60 (high severity of depressive symptoms).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 12, Week 28, Week 52 or Early Termination
outcome.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Days 1 to 3: 40 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID); Days 4 to 7: 60 mg BID; Days 8 to15: 80 mg BID; Day 16 to Week 52: 20-80 mg BID flexible dosing.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) - Total Score
measure.description: Measures the overall severity of depressive symptoms. The MADRS has a 10-item checklist. Items are rated on a scale of 0-6, for a total score range of 0 (low severity of depressive symptoms) to 60 (high severity of depressive symptoms).
measure.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS)
outcome.description: 11-item scale that measures the severity of manic episodes from subject reported symptoms over previous 48 hours and clinical observation during interview. Four items (irritability, speech, thought content, disruptive-aggressive behaviour) are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 8 (symptom extremely severe). The remaining 7 items (elevated mood, increased motor activity-energy, sexual interest, sleep, language-thought disorder, appearance, insight) are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 4 (symptom extremely severe). YMRS total score range = 0 to 60.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 12, Week 28, Week 52 or Early Termination
outcome.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Days 1 to 3: 40 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID); Days 4 to 7: 60 mg BID; Days 8 to15: 80 mg BID; Day 16 to Week 52: 20-80 mg BID flexible dosing.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS)
measure.description: 11-item scale that measures the severity of manic episodes from subject reported symptoms over previous 48 hours and clinical observation during interview. Four items (irritability, speech, thought content, disruptive-aggressive behaviour) are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 8 (symptom extremely severe). The remaining 7 items (elevated mood, increased motor activity-energy, sexual interest, sleep, language-thought disorder, appearance, insight) are rated on a scale from 0 (symptom not present) to 4 (symptom extremely severe). YMRS total score range = 0 to 60.
measure.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Clinical Global Impression - Severity (CGI-S) Subscale
outcome.description: CGI-S: 7-point clinician rated scale to assess severity of participant's current illness state; range: 1 (normal - not ill at all) to 7 (among the most extremely ill patients). Higher score = more affected.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 12, Week 28, Week 52 or Early Termination
outcome.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Days 1 to 3: 40 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID); Days 4 to 7: 60 mg BID; Days 8 to15: 80 mg BID; Day 16 to Week 52: 20-80 mg BID flexible dosing.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Clinical Global Impression - Severity (CGI-S) Subscale
measure.description: CGI-S: 7-point clinician rated scale to assess severity of participant's current illness state; range: 1 (normal - not ill at all) to 7 (among the most extremely ill patients). Higher score = more affected.
measure.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

outcome.title: Clinical Global Impression - Improvement (CGI-I) Subscale Score
outcome.description: CGI-I: 7-point clinician rated scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved), 2 (much improved), or 3 (minimally improved) on the scale. Higher score = more affected.
outcome.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Days 1 to 3: 40 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID); Days 4 to 7: 60 mg BID; Days 8 to15: 80 mg BID; Day 16 to Week 52: 20-80 mg BID flexible dosing.

measure.title: Clinical Global Impression - Improvement (CGI-I) Subscale Score
measure.description: CGI-I: 7-point clinician rated scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved), 2 (much improved), or 3 (minimally improved) on the scale. Higher score = more affected.
measure.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Drug Attitude Inventory (DAI)
outcome.description: DAI, a 10-item scale to assess how the attitude of schizophrenia participants toward their medications may affect compliance. Respondents indicate 'true' or 'false' for each item. An overall calculated score ranged from -10 to 10, where a positive score indicated a positive subjective response (compliant), a negative score indicated non-compliance. Change: score at observation minus score at baseline.
outcome.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Days 1 to 3: 40 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID); Days 4 to 7: 60 mg BID; Days 8 to15: 80 mg BID; Day 16 to Week 52: 20-80 mg BID flexible dosing.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Drug Attitude Inventory (DAI)
measure.description: DAI, a 10-item scale to assess how the attitude of schizophrenia participants toward their medications may affect compliance. Respondents indicate 'true' or 'false' for each item. An overall calculated score ranged from -10 to 10, where a positive score indicated a positive subjective response (compliant), a negative score indicated non-compliance. Change: score at observation minus score at baseline.
measure.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Social and Occupational Functioning Assessment Scale (SOFAS)
outcome.description: 0-100 single score scale focusing exclusively on participant's level of social and occupational functioning; not directly influenced by overall severity of participant's psychological symptoms; higher score = higher level of functioning. 1 to 10 = persistent inability to maintain minimal personal hygiene; unable to function without harming self or others or without considerable external support; 91 to 100 = superior functioning in a wide range of activities.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 28, Week 52 or Early Termination
outcome.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Days 1 to 3: 40 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID); Days 4 to 7: 60 mg BID; Days 8 to15: 80 mg BID; Day 16 to Week 52: 20-80 mg BID flexible dosing.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Social and Occupational Functioning Assessment Scale (SOFAS)
measure.description: 0-100 single score scale focusing exclusively on participant's level of social and occupational functioning; not directly influenced by overall severity of participant's psychological symptoms; higher score = higher level of functioning. 1 to 10 = persistent inability to maintain minimal personal hygiene; unable to function without harming self or others or without considerable external support; 91 to 100 = superior functioning in a wide range of activities.
measure.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in EuroQoL Index (EQ-I)
outcome.description: EQ-5D: subject rated questionnaire to assess health-related quality of life in terms of a single utility score. Health State Profile component assesses level of current health for 5 domains: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain and discomfort, and anxiety and depression; 1 indicates better health state (no problems); 3 indicates worst health state (confined to bed). Scoring formula developed by EuroQol Group assigns a utility value for each domain in the profile. Score is transformed and results in a total score range -0.594 to 1.000; higher score indicates a better health state.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 28, Week 52 or Early Termination
outcome.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Days 1 to 3: 40 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID); Days 4 to 7: 60 mg BID; Days 8 to15: 80 mg BID; Day 16 to Week 52: 20-80 mg BID flexible dosing.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in EuroQoL Index (EQ-I)
measure.description: EQ-5D: subject rated questionnaire to assess health-related quality of life in terms of a single utility score. Health State Profile component assesses level of current health for 5 domains: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain and discomfort, and anxiety and depression; 1 indicates better health state (no problems); 3 indicates worst health state (confined to bed). Scoring formula developed by EuroQol Group assigns a utility value for each domain in the profile. Score is transformed and results in a total score range -0.594 to 1.000; higher score indicates a better health state.
measure.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in European Quality of Life (EuroQol) Visual Analogue Scale (EQ-5D VAS): Current Health State Score
outcome.description: EQ-5D: subject rated questionnaire to assess health-related quality of life in terms of a single index value. The VAS component rates current health state on a scale from 0 (worst imaginable health state) to 100 (best imaginable health state); higher scores indicate a better health state.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 28, Week 52 or Early Termination
outcome.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Days 1 to 3: 40 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID); Days 4 to 7: 60 mg BID; Days 8 to15: 80 mg BID; Day 16 to Week 52: 20-80 mg BID flexible dosing.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in European Quality of Life (EuroQol) Visual Analogue Scale (EQ-5D VAS): Current Health State Score
measure.description: EQ-5D: subject rated questionnaire to assess health-related quality of life in terms of a single index value. The VAS component rates current health state on a scale from 0 (worst imaginable health state) to 100 (best imaginable health state); higher scores indicate a better health state.
measure.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Impact of Weight on Quality of Life-Lite Version (IWQOL-Lite) Scale
outcome.description: 31-item self report inventory to assess impact of weight on quality of life. Five subscales: physical functioning, self-esteem, sexual life, public distress, and work, with categories in each subscale scored 1 (no trouble or difficulty) to 5 (persistent trouble or difficulty). The rescaled IWQoL-Lite score is determined by the sum of scores on all 31 items and rescaling this sum to a 1 to 100 scoring with 0=the poorest and 100=the best quality of life.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 28, Week 52 or Early Termination
outcome.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Days 1 to 3: 40 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID); Days 4 to 7: 60 mg BID; Days 8 to15: 80 mg BID; Day 16 to Week 52: 20-80 mg BID flexible dosing.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Impact of Weight on Quality of Life-Lite Version (IWQOL-Lite) Scale
measure.description: 31-item self report inventory to assess impact of weight on quality of life. Five subscales: physical functioning, self-esteem, sexual life, public distress, and work, with categories in each subscale scored 1 (no trouble or difficulty) to 5 (persistent trouble or difficulty). The rescaled IWQoL-Lite score is determined by the sum of scores on all 31 items and rescaling this sum to a 1 to 100 scoring with 0=the poorest and 100=the best quality of life.
measure.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Suicidal Tendencies (Columbian-Suicide Severity Rating Scale, [C-SSRS], Mapped to C-CASA [Columbia Classification Algorithm For Suicide Assessment])
outcome.description: C-SSRS is a participant rated questionnaire to assess suicidal ideation, suicidal behavior, actual attempts (yes or no responses), and intensity of ideation (rated 1=low severity to 5=high severity). Yes/No responses are mapped to Columbia Classification Algorithm of Suicide Assessment (C-CASA) categories: Completed suicide, suicide attempt, preparatory acts toward imminent suicidal behavior, suicidal ideation, and self-injurious behavior, or no suicidal intent. A participant could have a yes or no response in more than one category.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1 through Week 52 or Early Termination
outcome.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Days 1 to 3: 40 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID); Days 4 to 7: 60 mg BID; Days 8 to15: 80 mg BID; Day 16 to Week 52: 20-80 mg BID flexible dosing.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Suicidal Tendencies (Columbian-Suicide Severity Rating Scale, [C-SSRS], Mapped to C-CASA [Columbia Classification Algorithm For Suicide Assessment])
measure.description: C-SSRS is a participant rated questionnaire to assess suicidal ideation, suicidal behavior, actual attempts (yes or no responses), and intensity of ideation (rated 1=low severity to 5=high severity). Yes/No responses are mapped to Columbia Classification Algorithm of Suicide Assessment (C-CASA) categories: Completed suicide, suicide attempt, preparatory acts toward imminent suicidal behavior, suicidal ideation, and self-injurious behavior, or no suicidal intent. A participant could have a yes or no response in more than one category.
measure.population: PP and ITT. Results not reported: data not summarized due to limited enrollment and early termination of the study.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Days 1 to 3: 40 milligrams (mg) twice daily (BID); Days 4 to 7: 60 mg BID; Days 8 to15: 80 mg BID; Day 16 to Week 52: 20-80 mg BID flexible dosing.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This study was terminated due to slow enrollment and changes in organizational strategy and resources; most of the planned analyses in the statistical analysis plan were not performed.
